reviews.text:
My family and I used to visit Jurong Hill Park quite frequently over 20 years ago, mainly because there was a fantastic restaurant there that served delicious and affordable food. It was always a great spot for a casual meal with a view. Sadly, the restaurant closed down about 10 years ago, which led to us visiting the park less often.

Recently, I had the chance to visit the park again, and it was a pleasant reminder of the peaceful moments we spent there in the past. The view overlooking the Tuas Industrial Park is quite unique and gives you a different perspective of the area. Despite the surrounding industrial landscape, the park itself is still a calm and serene place to unwind and relax.

However, it was unfortunate to discover that the park‚Äôs remaining facilities were also closed during my visit. While it was still nice to revisit the spot for old memories, it felt a bit empty without the restaurant and the usual vibrancy it once had. Even so, if you're looking for a quiet place to chill and take in the scenery, Jurong Hill Park still offers a peaceful atmosphere. It‚Äôs a place that holds nostalgic value for me, even though it‚Äôs not quite the same as it used to be.

This is an absolute beauty for sunrise/sunsets, peaceful getaway in the west and for serene bird‚Äôs eye view from the highest point in the west. It feels abandoned with the garden of fame and tower accessible via a road (behind bird park), no one would explore if they didn‚Äôt know about the place. There‚Äôre cyclists, exercisers, dog walkers, bird watchers, mediators, history lovers and for seeing the planted trees by dignitaries in the past.

By public transport, it‚Äôs one stop by 194 from Boonlay and 10min uphill walk up the road adjacent to the Jurong Bird Park (should I say old, because it‚Äôs moving to The Central catchment area).

Quiet place worth a visit after a trip to the bird park. Might take some walking if one does not drive. Good views overlooking Jurong industrial estate. Saw a huge colourful lizard while on the way down.

üëçüëèüòâThe 18m-tall three-storey spiral Jurong Hill Tower was of the Built-in on top of the 60m-tall Jurong Hill. I used to visit the Teppan Yaki and Indonesia Restaurant in 1970. It really brings back good memories. The Japanese food was good, and the surround planted trees by famous people and royalty who came over the years. It was known as an inspiration point. Where boys will bring their sweetheart there to enjoy the scenery üòâ üòòüòã

We went to this place last week.Not so crowded. But there were some photoshoot going on in the tower(upper level) and also a group were celebrating their birthday. Anyways they are doing some construction works so if you want to go to the tower,u need to walk up further.If you are driving, its easier.Peaceful.But be careful, got rats.And the toilets are situated near the carpark.
